clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Paramedical Consultation in Type 1 Diabetic Patients in Telemedicine

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre d’Etudes et de Recherche pour l’Intensification du Traitement du Diabète

clinical_study.source: Centre d’Etudes et de Recherche pour l’Intensification du Traitement du Diabète

brief_summary.textblock: Feasibility monocentrique opened study estimating the use of an electronic personalized educational plan (ePEP) for the follow-up by nurses of 50 patients diabetics type 1 during 6 months having an electronic pad.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patient using the system
primary_outcome.description: The using of the system is estimated by the frequency of dose proposition by electronic pad

secondary_outcome.measure: satisfaction level of the patient and quality of life

secondary_outcome.description: The satisfaction level of physician about the follow-up by e-PEP

secondary_outcome.measure: satisfaction level of the telemedecin nurse
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the satisfaction level of the telemedecin nurse about the follow-up by e-PEP

study_pop.textblock: Diabetic type 1 patients with the electronic pad

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient diabetic type 1
- patient with the electronic pad in a smartphone
- adults
- children between 12 and 17 years 11 months
- patient having signed the consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient diabetic type 2
- patient without the electronic pad in a smartphone
- children below 12 years old
